content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the Return Policy for Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt on Amazon. Color: Black, Size: XX-Large. If Free return is avaliable, tell me how to return this item.  Please interact with https://www.amazon.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find the return policy for the specified shirt on Amazon, first I need to search for the product using the search bar at the top. The search textbox is element [1], and I need to enter the product name and relevant details.
Action: Type [1]; Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt Black XX-Large
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
token: : Type [1]; Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt Black XX-Large

content: Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The product "HZCX FASHION Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt Round Collar Short Sleeve Tees" matches the description and appears as the first item in the search results. To view the return policy and check if free returns are available for the Black, XX-Large variant, I need to click on this product to open its page and find the relevant details.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The product page is loaded, and the color "942 Black" is already selected. The next step is to select the correct size (XX-Large) to check if the free return policy applies, as return policies can depend on the specific size and color chosen.
Action: Click [54]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Select Size" dropdown has been activated, but no sizes are shown in the current screenshot. To proceed to find and select "XX-Large," I need to scroll down to see the size options and any size-related return policy notes.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.35

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[9]: "Size:";	[10]: "Select Size";	[16]: "Size Chart";	[17]: "{*Size Note*}:you choose the t-shirt as your us size,which is relax fit";	[18]: "{*Unique Design*}:the mens graphic t shirt use the shiny rinestone,skull graphic,tiger,bear,skullkinds of graphic tees,you should find them in our store.";	[19]: "{*Material*}:cotton summer short sleeve oversized tees,soft,breathable.crew neck,basical style with shiny rhinestone.";	[20]: "See more About this item";	[22]: "Sponsored", "Leave feedback on Sponsored ad";

content:
Thought: The available size options are now visible, including "XX-Large." I need to select "XX-Large" to update the product page with any size-specific details, including the return policy and free returns availability.
Action: Click [15]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.4

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[15]: "Size:";	[16]: "XX-Large";	[22]: "Size Chart";	[23]: "{*Size Note*}:you choose the t-shirt as your us size,which is relax fit";	[24]: "30-day refund / replacement";	[25]: "Secure transaction";	[26]: "See more";	[28]: "Add to List";	[30]: "Sponsored", "Leave feedback on Sponsored ad";

content:
Thought: The screenshot shows that for size XX-Large, the return policy is stated as "30-day refund / replacement," but there is no clear indication that free returns are available. To confirm if "Free returns" is offered, I should look for any specific mention of "Free returns" (often placed near the price or below the size selection on Amazon), or in the expanded return details if needed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6

Thought: The product details and right-hand side section only mention "30-day refund / replacement" under Returns, but there is no mention of "Free returns" anywhere visible. This implies that free return shipping is likely not offered (if it was, there would typically be a "Free returns" label or link).
Action: ANSWER; The Return Policy for the Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt (Black, Size: XX-Large) on Amazon is "30-day refund / replacement". There is no indication that Free Return is available for this item. If you wish to return it, you can do so within 30 days of receipt for a refund or replacement, but return shipping may not be free. To return the item: 
1. Go to "Returns & Orders" on your Amazon account.
2. Find your order, select this shirt, and choose "Return or Replace Items".
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to print a return label and ship the item back.

Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 1.0
token:
: ANSWER; The Return Policy for the Mens Rhinestone Skull Graphic Shirt (Black, Size: XX-Large) on Amazon is "30-day refund / replacement". There is no indication that Free Return is available for this item. If you wish to return it, you can do so within 30 days of receipt for a refund or replacement, but return shipping may not be free. To return the item: 
1. Go to "Returns & Orders" on your Amazon account.
2. Find your order, select this shirt, and choose "Return or Replace Items".
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to print a return label and ship the item back.
